div.p: This page describes how to use LOINC with HL7 Standards.
IMPORTANT NOTE:As of UMLS v17AB, NDF-RT is no longer being maintained and has been replaced by the Medication Reference Terminology (MED-RT). Further documentation on MED-RT can be found in evs.

tr.td: the National Drug File - Reference Terminology - prepared by Veterans Health Administration, and distributed as part of UMLS by the NLM (direct link)
The URI to identify NDF-RT is not resolved. As a temporary arrangement, the URL "http://hl7.org/fhir/ndfrt" is to be used
A version is not needed. (Use the date of the UMLS release for the version of NDF-RT if a version is desired.)
The NUI is used for the code value for an NDF-RT concept

div.p: This URL is temporary while the NDF-RT and HL7 teams discuss the long term arrangements. Further documentation can be found in evs.
NDF-RT is released as part of UMLS. Therefore, each successive release has the date of the UMLS release as its version.
NDF-RT has no copyright acknowledgement required. However, users must adhere to the UMLS license.
This section documents the property filters that can be used with the NDF-RT code system in value set composition statements.

tr.td: Select a set of concepts based on subsumption testing
Includes all concepts that have a transitive is-a relationship with the concept Id provided in the value as an NUI (including the concept itself)
